snippet: A drop in the cost of food and gasoline last month has helped lead to the highest consumer sentiment readings since January 2007.
abstract: Labor Dept reports Producer Price Index fell 0.2 percent in November after rising by same amount in October; producer prices have risen just 1.4 percent in last 12 months; falling gas and food costs pushed down overall wholesale prices, evidence that cheaper oil is limiting inflation.
lead_paragraph: A drop in the cost of food and gasoline last month has helped lead to the highest consumer sentiment readings since January 2007.

headline.main: Falling Food and Gas Prices Stoke Consumer Confidence
headline.print_headline: Falling Food and Gas Prices Stoke Consumer Confidence
